result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikolay S. Kostadinov was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nikolay S. Kostadinov is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nikolay S. Kostadinov was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nikolay S. Kostadinov

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 911 Clerk HM.      Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.   DE appears with Atty Cafferty.    Victim appears.    Victim, E.K., sworn in and testified.   Court hears argument.  Court denies request for restitution.
Restitution hearing on June 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
UW-Parkside Certificate of Completion
$868.00 due in 30 days or civil judgment.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Nikolay S. Kostadinov, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $250 plus costs & surcharges and is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.  Atty Drees requests stay be allowed 60 days to determine if there is going to be any restitution; so ordered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Nikolay S. Kostadinov, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty. Clerk: PT
Atty Cafferty requests an adjournment for further negotations with the state and court grants adjournment.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

DV Safety Plan
Scheduling Order

Defendant, Nikolay S. Kostadinov, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Motion for Modification of Bond by DE; arguments heard; Court modifies bond to a $7500 signature bond with no violent contact and no discussion with Elizabeth Kostadinov.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

*No violent contact and no discussion with Elizabeth K or her residence/employment.
